page.title: 13SUTTON BONINGTON SCOUTING
page.content: In 1907{Lord Baden Powell}returned from the{Boer War.}He decided it was necessary to start a{scouting}movement for the physical and spiritual education of youth. It began with the{Boy Scouts}and later was joined by{Cubs, Rose Buds (Brownies) and{Guides. There has been{scouting}in the village on and off from early times but the recent{troops}have been in operation for about thirty years. They have five groups, the{Venture Scouts, Scouts, {Guides, Cubs}and{Brownies.}The village is fortunate in having a{Scout HQ}at the playing fields which was built and is maintained by supportive parents.
